repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: Various notes by Édouard Ariel, on philology.
Various papers of various format bound in one volume: notes, extracts of books copied, etc. Subject-headers of top right of rectos.

The volume opens with a title page (U1) and the contents (U2) is distributed by contents units, separated by intertitle pages, as follows in:
f22r: φlologie voyelles & semi-voyelles.
f46r: φlologie a.
f66r: φlologie I et y.
f83r: φlologie e.
f93r: φlologie u.
f1r05: φlologie o.
f108r: φlologie ṛ / ḷ.
f131r: φlologie anusvara & visarga.
f143r: φlologie h.
f156r: φlologie consonnes chuintantes et sifflantes gutturales cérébrales et dentales labiales.
f164r: φlologie gutturales.
f180r: φlologie chuintantes et sifflantes .
f209r: φlologie cérébrales & Dentales.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 242 folios = Ariel Papers: Philology. Arabic library foliation 1-242.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: FR. NOUV. ACQ 8890 (spine).

Binder's note (f[1]r):
Volume de 242 Feuillets
19 Mars 1896.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outer faces.

origin.origDate: Not after 1854, since part of the papers of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Autograph work by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

body.ab:
alphabet
Il est, dans presque toutes les langues européennes,
des lettres qui sont prononcées autrement que les mêmes lettres
en français; des noms étrangers ont été souvent écrits
en français comme on les a entendu prononcer, et cette
manière d'écrire est passée en usage.
Alphabet samaritain d'après
